22:39:03 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fc56751037cbd0018612fcc?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"aa7dbe917f2b2fd737cf648432eb1815","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn6@2020_6/2020/12/01/06-05-19-905_9053b789ca737840.webp","destWidth":2100,"destHeight":1575,"sourceBytes":377560,"destBytes":377560,"author":"ljohnson@businessinsider.com (Lauren Johnson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fc56751037cbd0018612fcc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn6@2020_6/2020/12/01/06-05-19-905_9053b789ca737840.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fb417471c741f0019aca39e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn77@2020_6/2020/12/01/06-05-55-518_b2edb8b6e1ac3a25.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc56aa9037cbd0018612fd7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn15@2020_6/2020/12/01/06-05-58-380_8da57f4d0333dde5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn26@2020_1/2020/12/01/06-05-55-966_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AYBsm2c7k04:PRA2bTXqRDY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AYBsm2c7k04:PRA2bTXqRDY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn53@2020_5/2020/12/01/06-05-45-657_9ef79c0e3101e6da.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn22@2020_1/2020/12/01/06-05-47-414_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AYBsm2c7k04:PRA2bTXqRDY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn37@2020_6/2020/12/01/06-05-41-448_b6db665a75408daa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/AYBsm2c7k04":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn65@2020_6/2020/12/01/06-05-55-072_c009f60b13bd3989.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606802719434},{"createdTime":"2020-12-01 14:05:19","updatedTime":"2020-12-01 14:05:19","title":"Biden's decision to pick Neera Tanden for a top economic role exposes an ongoing rift with Bernie Sanders-allied progressives","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/bidens-omb-pick-condemned-by-bernie-sanders-aligned-progressives-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc50ca550e71a0011557ede?format=jpeg\" alt=\"CAP President Neera Tanden moderates the &#34;Why Women&#39;s Economic Security Matters For All&#34; panel discussion at The Center For American Progress on September 18, 2014 in Washington, DC.\" height=\"640\" width=\"1280\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Neera Tanden in 2014.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Morigi/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President-elect Joe Biden has angered both progressive Democrats and Republicans with his announcement that he will nominate Neera Tanden to direct the Office of Management and Budget.&#160;</li>\n<li>Tanden, the head of the influential liberal think tank Center for American Progress, is a longtime advisor to Hillary Clinton and has made numerous enemies among both progressive Democrats and Republicans.</li>\n<li>While some Republicans insisted Tanden wouldn't be confirmed by the Senate, a slew of progressives aligned with Sen. Bernie Sanders slammed Tanden's likely nomination as divisive.</li>\n<li>\"There are very few people who have been as aggressively critical &#8212; I would say sometimes obsessively critical &#8212; of the progressive left, and in particular of Bernie Sanders, than Neera,\" a former senior Center for American Progress employee told Business Insider.</li>\n<li>But several prominent progressives, including Sen. Elizabeth Warren and Rep. Barbara Lee, endorsed Biden's pick.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President-elect Joe Biden sparked backlash from some progressive Democrats and Republicans with his announcement that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-biden-senate-confirmation-fight-neera-tanden-economic-pick-2020-11\">he'd nominate</a> Neera Tanden, the head of the influential liberal think tank Center for American Progress, to direct his Office of Management and Budget.&#160;</p><p>Tanden is a longtime advisor to Hillary Clinton. She played a key role in her 2008 and 2016 presidential campaigns and helped engineer the Affordable Care Act in the Obama administration. She would be the first woman of color to run OMB, the agency responsible for drawing up and implementing the federal government's annual spending plan — a particularly important position as the country faces a pandemic-provoked recession.&#160;</p><h2>Controversial on the left and right</h2><p>As a Clinton aide, Tanden was a particularly outspoken critic of Sen. Bernie Sanders during the 2016 presidential primary and has since tangled online with the democratic socialist's supporters. Sanders-aligned progressives have for years been critical of Tanden's centrist politics, including her opposition to single-payer healthcare, support for cuts to Social Security, and <a href=\"https://www.huffpost.com/entry/netanyahu-center-for-american-progress_n_56301482e4b0631799100532?kezpk3xr=\">friendliness</a> with Israel's conservative leadership.</p><p>During the 2020 presidential primary, Sanders <a href=\"https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/5839898-Bernie-Sanders-Letter-Accusing-CAP-of.html\">accused Tanden</a> and the Center for American Progress of \"maligning my staff and supporters and belittling progressive ideas.\"</p><p>At the Center for American Progress, Tanden has come under scrutiny from some of her own colleagues over <a href=\"https://theintercept.com/2015/11/05/leaked-emails-from-pro-clinton-group-reveal-censorship-of-staff-on-israel-aipac-pandering-warped-militarism/\">allegations that she censored employees</a> who were critical of Israel while the organization attempted to build a stronger bond between the Democratic Party and the right-wing Israeli government. Under Tanden, the think tank <a href=\"https://www.thedailybeast.com/thinkprogress-to-be-archived-after-union-threatens-legal-options-against-cap\">shut down</a> its independent journalistic arm, Think Progress, last year following its unionization.</p><p>A former senior Center for American Progress employee told Business Insider that he and other employees believed Tanden used the influential organization as \"an engine for her ambition,\" sometimes at her colleagues' expense.&#160;</p><p>Some Sanders-aligned progressives consider Biden's decision to tap Tanden for such an influential White House job a slap in the face.</p><p>\"There are very few people who have been as aggressively critical — I would say sometimes obsessively critical — of the progressive left, and in particular of Bernie Sanders, than Neera,\" the former employee said.&#160;</p><p>Briahna Joy Gray, a former press secretary for Sanders' 2020 presidential campaign, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/briebriejoy/status/1333268563872899073?s=20\">tweeted</a>, \"Everything toxic about the corporate Democratic Party is embodied in Neera Tanden.\"</p><p>Sanders has not made any public statement on Biden's decision.&#160;</p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-get-job-biden-administration-white-house-hiring-career-2020-11?r=oo-kush\">Joe Biden is hiring about 4,000 political staffers to work in the White House and federal agencies. Here's how you can boost your chances getting a job in the new administration, according to 3 experts.</a></em></p><p>A Biden transition official defended Tanden's \"policy chops\" and said her lived experience relying on government social programs as a child made her well-suited to a job that helps determine funding for the safety net.&#160;</p><p>\"The fact that Neera not only has the policy experience and expertise but also has the background to relate to all of those needs makes her an incredibly compelling choice to lead the office,\" the official told Business Insider.</p><p>Tanden wrote about her lived experience in a Monday tweet about her likely nomination.&#160;</p><p>\"After my parents were divorced when I was young, my mother relied on public food and housing programs to get by. Now, I'm being nominated to help ensure those programs are secure, and ensure families like mine can live with dignity,\" she <a href=\"https://twitter.com/neeratanden/status/1333513295043686400\">wrote</a>. \"I am beyond honored.\"</p><p>Some Republicans condemned Tanden's likely nomination, saying she'd never be confirmed by a GOP-controlled Senate. (If Democrats fail to win both Senate runoff races in Georgia in January, Republicans will maintain their majority in the chamber and have the power to reject Biden's nominees).&#160;</p><p>Drew Brandewie, the communications director for Republican Sen. John Cornyn of Texas, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/DBrandewie/status/1333205134004858889\">tweeted</a> on Sunday that Tanden \"stands zero chance of being confirmed\" because of critical comments she's made about Republican lawmakers in recent years.</p><p>Cornyn followed up on that statement Monday, saying Tanden is Biden's \"worst nominee so far.\"</p><p>\"I think, in light of her combative and insulting comments about many members of the Senate, mainly on our side of the aisle, that it creates certainly a problematic path,\" he <a href=\"https://twitter.com/seungminkim/status/1333522271751852035\">told</a> The Washington Post.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc5624650e71a0011558107?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: Democratic presidential candidate and former Vice President Joe Biden shakes hands with and hugs Senator Elizabeth Warren after a question about their ages during the fourth U.S. Democratic presidential candidates 2020 election debate at Otterbein University in Westerville, Ohio U.S., October 15, 2019. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton\" height=\"1689\" width=\"3378\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President-elect Joe Biden with Sen. Elizabeth Warren.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2>A boost of support from influential Democrats</h2><p>A host of prominent Democrats, including House and Senate members and influential party operatives, defended Tanden amid the criticism. Sens. Sherrod Brown and Cory Booker and progressive Rep. Barbara Lee released statements defending Tanden's record. Notably, Sen. Elizabeth Warren, a longtime progressive critic of Biden, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/SenWarren/status/1333480261338738691\">endorsed</a> Tanden's selection in a Monday tweet.&#160;</p><p>Stacey Abrams, a former Georgia gubernatorial candidate and a rising star in the Democratic Party, praised Tanden's selection, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/staceyabrams/status/1333183697948913665\">tweeting</a> that she was \"very proud.\" And Sen. Jon Tester of Montana, a moderate Democrat, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/JakeSherman/status/1333513150512193536\">said</a> he \"absolutely\" supported Tanden's nomination.&#160;</p><p>And some other Sanders-aligned progressives expressed relief that Biden went with Tanden over other candidates, including Biden's former chief of staff Bruce Reed, who championed deficit-reduction efforts during the Obama administration. Notably, Tanden <a href=\"https://www.huffpost.com/entry/grand-bargain-center-for-american-progress_n_3393895\">rejected</a> the Obama White House's attempts to reach a deficit-reduction deal with Republicans in 2013, arguing that the government should be focused on growing the economy.</p><p>\"Neera Tanden is not a pick progressives would have chosen, but she's better than Bruce Reed,\" Alexandra Rojas, the executive director of the progressive group Justice Democrats, told Business Insider. \"Tanden's on the record over the past several years pushing back against nonsensical worries about the deficit. Reed has been more of an ideological deficit hawk throughout his career.\"&#160;</p><p>Justice Democrats celebrated Biden's decision to pick the progressive economists Heather Boushey and Jared Bernstein for his Council of Economic Advisers.&#160;</p><p>Sean McElwee, a Democratic pollster and cofounder of the think tank Data for Progress, told Business Insider that progressives \"were able to stop some bad potential nominees and Tanden is someone will listen to progressives on issues like climate, family leave and jobs.\"</p><p>But progressives also know Tanden isn't a sure bet for Biden. The former senior Center for American Progress employee said progressive activists likely also believed there was a chance Tanden wouldn't be confirmed and didn't want to spend their political capital opposing a doomed nomination.</p><p>\"People definitely understand that progressives might not have to expend a lot of powder on Neera Tanden because Republicans are already out there saying what they're saying,\" he said.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Relman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fc50ca550e71a0011557ede?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn85@2020_3/2020/12/01/06-05-49-225_71f1dbecfc4b8c31.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc5624650e71a0011558107?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn54@2020_1/2020/12/01/06-05-48-934_77dd09b17a2538c9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn26@2020_1/2020/12/01/06-05-55-966_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HNmd8Cqc3Es:k_ULpVuJ-Zc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn58@2020_3/2020/12/01/06-05-51-949_06ea6022a81f9a84.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HNmd8Cqc3Es:k_ULpVuJ-Zc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn55@2020_3/2020/12/01/06-05-58-511_46132e52effe6126.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn22@2020_1/2020/12/01/06-05-47-414_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HNmd8Cqc3Es:k_ULpVuJ-Zc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn53@2020_1/2020/12/01/06-05-51-941_ef6d6eed8f8d063e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/HNmd8Cqc3Es":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn61@2020_5/2020/12/01/06-05-46-711_c70075aa2f77012f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606802719448},{"createdTime":"2020-12-01 14:05:19","updatedTime":"2020-12-01 14:05:19","title":"Amazon reviews complaining about a 'lack of smell' from scented candles appeared to increase as coronavirus cases spiked","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/scented-candle-lack-smell-reviews-amazon-possible-tie-rise-coronavirus-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e7b55cdba85ee67810251f5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Candles\" height=\"801\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/cozy-home-interior-decor-burning-candles-1037164117\" target=\"_blank\">Daria Minaeva / Shutterstock</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>After seeing a tweet about the recent rise of frustrated reviews on the Yankee Candle website, researcher Kate Petrova decided to see if if was part of a larger trend by visualizing her findings on scented candle reviews from Amazon.</li>\n<li>Loss of smell is a common symptom of coronavirus, and it could be tied to a rise in candle reviewers complaining of a \"lack of smell.\"</li>\n<li>While this was just a fun project, these findings could be a starting point for those who want to research this topic further.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>As coronavirus cases rose across the country, it appears that negative reviews of scented candles on Amazon increased too.</p><p>Kate Petrova, a research assistant for Harvard Study of Adult Development at Bryn Mawr College, did some quick data plotting during her free time that further explored the idea after stumbling upon a tweet that said reviewers on Yankee Candle's website were complaining about the candles lacking smell.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Kate Petrova  (@kate_ptrv) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1332398737604431874?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 27, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>In her findings, Petrova said the number of Amazon candle reviews that mentioned \"lack of smell\" grew from&#160; less than 2% in January to nearly 6% in November, and satisfaction with scented candles was dropping at a much faster rate than unscented candles.&#160;</p><p>During an interview with Business Insider, Petrova stressed these findings are \"just a fun exercise\" and it would take a much more in-depth study in order to conclude if there is a correlation between the two factors or if it's just serendipity.&#160;</p><p>\"We need to be careful in interpreting these numbers,\" said Petrova.</p><p>Regardless, Petrova said she is \"excited about the power and potential of data visualizations\" because of the traction this tweet has gotten.</p><p><strong><em>Read More:<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-vaccine-timeline-what-to-watch-leading-research-2020-3?r=bs-sub\">&#160;Drugmakers behind 3 coronavirus vaccines say they work. Here's everything we know about the race for a vaccine and when you might be able to get a shot.</a></em></strong></p><p>While loss of smell is one of the most common symptoms of COVID-19, some patients who have recovered from the virus have reported that their sense of smell was distorted once they recovered from the virus, which could also contribute to the influx of unsatisfactory reviews.</p><p>Earlier this month, <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/damaged-sense-of-smell-in-covid-patients-holds-clues-to-how-recovery-might-work-11606140319\">The Wall Street Journal</a> reported that 10-20% of those who lose their smell while battling the virus may find french fries \"smell like putrid, rotting meat,\" and the smell of coffee might remind someone of \"burning tires.\"</p><p>Petrova's entire thread is available to read <a href=\"https://twitter.com/kate_ptrv/status/1332398737604431874\">here.</a></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on
